column4: im having truoble with my wireless i got the card installed with ndiscwapper but it still does not show up
have you done sudo modprobe ndiswraper
it loads the ndiswrapper kernel module
you can configure your wireless till you die but if you dont load it then it wont do anything
then its not set up right
ok, have you added the ndiswrapper to the modules file so it gets autoloaded
id rerad the walkthrough ubottu gave you, you seem to have missed a lot out
that's offtopic here, this is support only
that's what the repos are for, they are all binaries..
http://www.alsa-project.org/main/index.php/Driver_Compilation   all the tar's are source though
apt-get install -d   will download the debs for you and put them in /var/cache/apt/archives
you'd run the apt-get command in Ubuntu, then transfer the files...
doesn't centos have sound or something?
